document.docAuthor: Palacio, Edgard, Bordera, Santiago, Sääksjärvi, Ilari E. & Díaz, Francisco
document.docTitle: Clistopyga taironae Palacio & Bordera & Sääksjärvi & Díaz 2018, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: The Neotropical species of Clistopyga (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Pimplinae). Part II: the C. isayae species group, with the description of seven new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Neotropical species of Clistopyga (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Pimplinae). Part II: the C. isayae species group, with the description of seven new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Clistopyga taironae
sp. nov.
can be distinguished from all other species of the
C. isayae
species group by the combination of the following characters: mesosoma yellow and black ( Figs 8D, I ); ocular orbits entirely bordered with yellow marks ( Figs 8A , 11E ); clypeal suture almost straight ( Fig. 8B ), clypeus 1.82˗1.92 × as broad as medially long; occipital carina present dorsally and ventrally ( Fig. 11E ); female hind wing with vein cu-a about 0.15 × as long as abscissa of Cu 1 between M and cu-a , abscissa of Cu 1 straight ( Fig. 8H ).
Description. Female: Body length 10.6–12.0 mm. Fore wing length 7.1–8.4 mm .

Wings ( Figs 8G–H ). Fore wing with vein cu-a opposite Rs&M . Vein 2 rs-m about 0.38 × as long as abscissa of M between 2 rs-m and 2 m-cu . Abscissa of Cu 1 between 1 m-cu and Cu 1 a 1.38–1.42 × as long as Cu 1 b ( Fig. 8G ). Hind wing with vein cu-a about 0.15 × as long as abscissa of Cu 1 between M and cu-a ( Fig. 8H ). Vein cu-a reclivous, abscissa of Cu 1 vertical, straight to slightly curved. Vein Cu 1 well pigmented.

Fore wing, upper and lower arrows indicates abscissa of Cu 1 (between 1 m-cu and Cu 1 a ) and vein Cu 1 b , respectively. H. Hind wing, upper and lower arrows indicates abscissa of Cu 1 (between M and cu-a ) and vein cu-a , respectively. I. Mesosoma , dorsal view. J. Metasoma, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Male ( Figs 10A–C ): similar to female but body length 8.7 mm ; fore wing length 6.0 mm; malar space 0.55 × as long as basal mandibular width; lower part of gena slightly concave, without a groove above mandibular base ( Fig. 10A ); hind wing with vein cu-a about 0.46 × as long as abscissa of Cu 1 between M and cu-a .
Colouration . Similar in colour to female but without white preapical posterolateral marks on tergites II˗V.

Etymology. This species is named in honour of the Precolombine indigenous tribe of Taironas, who lived in the territory that today is the type locality, the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta, Magdalena ( Colombia ).

Type material. Holotype
1♀ :
Colombia
, Magdalena , Sierra Nevada , La Estación, 10o48´N , 73o39´W , 2220 m , Malaise trap, 15–31 Aug 2000 , coll. J. Cantillo ( IAVH ).
